skill.name: geo-database
skill.description: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (GSE, GSM, GPL), retrieve SOFT/Matrix files, for transcriptomics and expression analysis.
skill.summary: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and example code for GEO access and analysis. No credential access, exfiltration, obfuscation, or execution backdoors are present. Network usage is limited to documented NCBI endpoints and FTP downloads.

content.user_title: Explore GEO datasets for expression analysis
content.value_statement: You need reliable access to public gene expression datasets. This skill guides you to search, download, and prepare GEO data with proven methods.
actual_capabilities: Search GEO DataSets and GEO Profiles with Entrez queries
Download GEO Series data with GEOparse and access metadata
Retrieve series matrix and SOFT files via FTP or wget
Filter samples by metadata and build expression matrices
Run example workflows for QC, differential expression, and clustering
limitations: Requires internet access to NCBI or FTP servers
Assumes Python libraries such as GEOparse and Biopython are installed
Does not validate biological conclusions or study quality automatically
Large datasets may require significant disk space and memory

use_cases.title: Find datasets for a thesis
use_cases.description: Locate GEO studies by disease and organism, then extract sample metadata for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Batch process GEO series
use_cases.description: Download multiple GSE accessions, summarize metadata, and save expression matrices for pipelines.

use_cases.title: Plan a meta analysis
use_cases.description: Identify comparable platforms and build a list of studies for cross study expression comparison.

prompt_templates.title: Find GEO datasets
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner search by disease and organism
prompt_templates.prompt: Find GEO DataSets for breast cancer in Homo sapiens and list the top 5 accessions with titles.

prompt_templates.title: Download a GSE
prompt_templates.prompt: Show Python steps to download GSE123456 with GEOparse and print sample titles and platforms.

prompt_templates.title: Get matrix via FTP
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide the FTP or wget commands to download the series matrix and SOFT files for GSE123456.

prompt_templates.title: Batch metadata
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a script outline to fetch metadata for a list of GSE accessions with Entrez, respecting rate limits.

output_examples.input: Summarize GSE123456 and list key sample counts and platform details.
output: Study title and brief summary from GEO metadata
Organism and platform accession used in the series
Number of samples and any listed experimental groups

best_practices: Set Entrez.email and follow NCBI rate limits
Cache downloaded files to avoid repeated transfers
anti_patterns: Running bulk downloads without rate limiting
Skipping metadata checks for sample groups
Assuming all series have matrix files

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The instructions are plain text and can be used in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: Are there limits on how many datasets I can query?
faq.answer: NCBI enforces rate limits. Use delays or an API key for higher request rates.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing Python pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The examples use GEOparse, Biopython, and pandas which integrate with standard workflows.

faq.question: Does the skill access my local credentials or files?
faq.answer: No. It only shows public GEO access methods and does not read local credential files.

faq.question: What should I do if GEOparse downloads fail?
faq.answer: Try direct FTP downloads or parse local files. Check network access and retry with smaller requests.

faq.question: How does this compare to GEO2R?
faq.answer: GEO2R is a web tool for quick analysis. This skill provides programmable workflows for automation.
